subject: Re: CW Program for morse code
author: Steve Hultay
full_text:
Thank you for doing that, i figured it was worth a shot at testing.  
I didn't set out for morse code today, i was toying with the idea of 
different sounding frequencies and through EvpMaker it sounded like 
morse code to me.  That's when the light bulb went off for the idea.  
I've stopped evpmaker and for some reason that Cwget program is still 
spitting out letters.  I wonder if there is a delay if there is too 
much coming out of the speakers at one time and the program has to 
play catch up.  

-Steve



--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Stefan Bion <yahoogroups@...> wrote:
>
> Hi Steve,
> 
> the CW decoder gets mainly the letters E, I and T.
> I also noticed that the beeps are all the same length in your file.
> 
> So I made a raw audio file for EVPmaker that contains three cues: 
The
> "dit" and "dah" beeps, and an "intra-character gap":
> 
> http://groups.yahoo.com/group/EVP-ITC/files/Stefan/Morse%
20code/morse.wav
> 
> The "Use Cue List" option must be checked in EVPmaker to use this 
file.
> 
> Now it sounds a bit more like actual morse code, and CwGet is able 
to
> decode more letters. Perhaps some former ham operators "over there" 
are
> able to use it... :)
> 
> Stefan
> 
> -- 
> 
> 
> > Here's the program if anybody wants to play around with it.  It 
also 
> > picks up stuff without playing the file through evpmaker and 
converts 
> > it into letters just by using the microphone on the computer.  
I'm 
> > going to try and figure this out later, you can also cancel out 
> > certain frequencies too.  It's worth exploring into this a bit.  
For 
> > those who don't get what i'm trying to do, i'm running my 
frequency 
> > file through evpmaker and it than sounds like morse code.  Than 
i'm 
> > using a program to try and convert the jumbled morse code 
sounding 
> > file from evpmaker into coherent messages typed on the computer 
> > screen.
> 
>   
> > The program is called Cwget.  I grew up on Ham Radio, so this 
doesn't 
> > sound so far fetched for me.  But sorry if i'm losing some people 
on 
> > this method.
> 
> > 73's
> > -Steve H.
> 
> > p.s.  The program was too large for yahoo, so here's a link:
> 
> > http://www.dxsoft.com/micwget.htm
> 
> 
> 
> > ------------------------------------
> 
> > Yahoo! Groups Links
>
